g.text: Tin Oxide QuantumDots for the Detection of Heavy
College of Information Science and Technology, Dalian Maritime University, Linghai Road 1,
Institute of Agriculture Resources and Regional Planning, Chinese Academy of Agricultural Sciences,
Received: 14 August 2019; Accepted: 6 September 2019; Published: 10 September 2019
Tin oxide quantum dots were synthesized in aqueous solution via a simple hydrolysis
and oxidation process. The morphology observation showed that the quantumdots had an average
grain size of 2.23 nm. The rutile phase SnO
was conﬁrmed by the structural and compositional
characterization. The ﬂuorescence spectroscopy of quantumdots was used to detect the heavy metal
quantum dots showed the response of 2.48 to 100 ppm Ni
exhibited prospective in the detection of heavy metal ions in contaminated water, including deionized
, reclaimed water and sea water. The limit of detection was as low
detection. The ﬁrst principle calculation based on the density function theory
demonstrated the dependence of ﬂuorescence response on the adsorption energy of heavy metal ions
as well as ion radius. The mechanismof ﬂuorescence response was discussed based on the interaction
ions. A linear correlation of ﬂuorescence emission intensity against
concentration was obtained in the logarithmic coordinates. The density of active Sn vacancies
was the crucial factor that determined ﬂuorescence response of SnO
tinoxide; quantumdot; heavymetal ion; water pollution; ﬂuorescence; sensingmechanism
Water pollution has become a grave concern throughout the world. Industrial wastewater
discharge heavy metals, which are produced from factories fabricating metals, papers and
]. These heavy metal ions bring severe risks to living creatures because most of them
are non-biodegradable and toxic even at trace levels [
and may accumulate in the aquatic and plant organisms [
]. The danger caused by heavy metals
are biomagniﬁed in the food web [
ions are one of the most fundamental elements in body
from the permissible limit could result in several severe diseases [
extremely low concentration increases the risks of cardiovascular disease and cancer, especially in
]. It is toxic to cells after the interaction with calciumand zinc proteins, which are important
in the process of cell signal transmission and gene expression [
fromenvironment to plants by the absorption through roots, causing withered or dead plants [
causes skin dermatitis, nausea, chronic asthma, coughing and
